phrases.text: What time does the pool open?
phrases.usage: Ask the receptionist this to find out the start time.
phrases.example: What time does the pool open for hotel guests today?

phrases.usage: Use this to check when the hotel restaurant stops serving.
phrases.example: What time does it close for dinner service on Sunday?

phrases.usage: The staff will use this to tell you the hours.
phrases.example: It’s open until eleven tonight for the late night menu.

phrases.usage: This explains the time a specific hotel area is ready.
phrases.example: It opens at six in the morning for early breakfast.

phrases.usage: Ask this if you need extra items for your room.
phrases.example: Do you have towels for us to use at the gym?

phrases.text: You can get them at the desk.
phrases.usage: The staff uses this to guide you to the supplies.
phrases.example: You can get them at the desk in the lobby.

phrases.usage: Ask this to see if the morning meal is free.
phrases.example: Is breakfast included with our standard room booking for tomorrow?

phrases.usage: Confirm the schedule so you do not miss your meal.
phrases.example: So it closes at ten, right? I want to eat.

keyVocabulary.definition: Located a short distance away from your current place.
A place that is full of too many people.
Something that is from the area where you are.
Food that has a very good and pleasant taste.
Useful or providing the assistance that you really need.
